content.title: Home Loan Interest Subsidy Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
content.department: Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat
content.beneficiary: Workers employed in the organized sector
content.details: The 'Home Loan Interest Subsidy Scheme' was launched by the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board. Under the scheme, a 3% Interest Subsidy is provided to workers who are employed in the organized sector to buy their own house and get relief from interest deductions on loans taken from banks.
benefits: The scheme offers a 3% Interest Subsidy to workers employed in the organized sector for purchasing their own house.
The maximum loan on a house purchased by a worker is ₹15 lakhs or an interest subsidy of 3% taking into account the bank interest on the loan actually taken, whichever is less.
The assistance amount will be credited to the beneficiary's bank account through DBT.
eligibility: Workers who are working in the organized sector in the state of Gujarat.
Workers should have been working continuously with the Factory/Company/Organization for one year and their Labour Welfare Fund should have been deposited in the board.
The purchase price of the house is a maximum of ₹30 lakhs.
The loan tenure should be 15 years or more.
Home loans should be taken from Nationalized/Scheduled Bank/NBFC only.
Application has to be made within one year from the date of purchase document.
documents_required: A copy of the identity card issued by the contractor to the worker/labour
Proof of taking a loan (loan sanction letter)

faqs.question: Who launched the 'Home Loan Interest Subsidy Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched by the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board, under the Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat.

faqs.question: What is the percentage of Interest Subsidy provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers a 3% Interest Subsidy to eligible workers.

faqs.question: What are the maximum loan limitations under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A worker can avail a maximum loan of ₹15 lakhs or the interest subsidy of 3%, whichever is less, considering the actual bank interest on the loan taken.

faqs.question: How is the assistance amount disbursed to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The assistance amount is credited directly to the beneficiary's bank account through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers employed in the organized sector in Gujarat are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the criteria for continuous employment under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers must have been continuously employed with the Factory/Company/Organization for at least one year.

faqs.question: What is the maximum purchase price of a house eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The purchase price of the house should not exceed ₹30 lakhs to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum tenure for a home loan under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The loan tenure should be 15 years or more.

faqs.question: From which financial institutions can a home loan be availed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Home loans should be obtained from Nationalized/Scheduled Bank/NBFC only.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications must be submitted within one year from the date of the purchase document.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the benefits of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can visit the Sanman Portal at https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/ to apply for the scheme benefits.

faqs.question: Can workers from any sector apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only workers employed in the organized sector in Gujarat are eligible for the scheme benefits.
